revised_title: Observations of a Lunar Eclipse by John Bevis and James Short
tldr: John Bevis and James Short observed a lunar eclipse at Mr. Graham's in Fleet-street. They used a reflecting telescope to measure the appulses of the shadow to the spot on Tycho, and their observations could be useful for geographical purposes. The beginning and end of the eclipse were estimated by the naked eye and a refracting telescope with small magnification.
